The phony letterhead template used in th: This template has been previously used to satirize former President Donald Trump and is not an official White House stationery.
The text of the letter: which states "Joe, you know I won," is a reference to Trump's false claims about the election being stolen from him. This statement aligns with Trump's rhetoric rather than a genuine letter from him.
The signature on the letter is different: s official correspondence. This inconsistency suggests that the letter is fabricated.
The inclusion of the White House address: According to presidential scholar Shirley Anne Warshaw, no official presidential letter includes the address, as it is widely known.
